certifications: GCP and 21CFR Part 11 Novartis Certified Professional
Certified PMP with Novartis Healthcare Pvt Ltd
Certified Software Quality Analyst CSQA Cognizant Professional
Certified Software Test Engineer CSTE Cognizant Professional

sections.text: SATEESH SRUNGAVARAPU Hyderabad, Telangana, India Mobile: 994 9983 618 E-Mail: srungas82@gmail.com Skype ID: sateesh@citadelpm.io LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/sateesh-srungavarapu-26926523

SUMMARY • Accomplished and scientific-minded professional having 16+ years of experience in clinical IRT operations, people management, R&D clinical software testing services, technical delivery, project management, and compliance • Demonstrable experience in providing clinical operations expertise into the project (e.g., country selection, feasibility, operational input into the design, risks, and external partner management) using new innovative design and delivery models to support governance interactions and project start-up • Extensive experience in directing a testing team of IVRS/IWRS clinical product applications across multiple vendors and leading standard IRT modules for reputed CRO IRT applications • Conversant in collaborating with Clinical Operations, Global Project Management, Quality Assurance and IT, as well as other cross-functional teams to provide management support and guidance regarding the identification, selection, and management of potential new business processes and systems (e.g., CTMS, TMF, Grant Management) in Clinical Operations and Clinical Development • Hands-on experience in maintaining a working knowledge of and assuring compliance with applicable ICH Guidelines, Good Clinical Practices, Regulatory Agency requirements, and Parexel SOPs • In-depth experience in maintaining optimal department processes through continual review and update of standard operating procedures, evaluation of supporting clinical software (e.g., EDC systems, external coding tools, etc.), and development of personnel within the department • Proven experience in managing end to end the User Acceptance Testing for enhancements to Clinical Systems, including identification, planning, sandbox testing, and running UAT • Successfully building strategic relationships with global teams (USA/UK/Basel/Japan/China); deft at working with global functional leaders and external partnerships to support and drive project/programme strategy GLOBAL EXPOSURE • Comprehensive experience in operating in a globally diverse environment and travelled to US (New Jersey) and Basel (Swiss) to provide support on new in-house IRT project activities and implemented in the company Novartis

CORE SKILLS Clinical IRT Operations | Site Management | Account Management | Bug Life Cycle | Customer Satisfaction | Strategic Partnership Management | Risk Assessment | Application Life Cycle Management | Compliant Management | User Requirements | R&D Clinical Software Testing | Project Management | Process Improvement | Agile Methodology | UAT Testing | Technical Delivery | Stakeholder Management | People Management | FDA, ICH, and GCP Guidelines TECHNICAL SKILLS Test Management Tools Mercury Quality Centre, Test Director, Jira Third-Party Applications Bayer User Access Management Application, IT4U PRIMA, Digital Signature, Bracket RTSM Cube, Bioclinica Trident, Perceptive SIRT, Cenduit SIRT, Synapse, Babylon, Clinadmin, NCT Portal

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE Director - Data Technology and Liaison| Citadel Precision Medicine LLC, India Oct 2021 - Ongoing Responsibilities: • Onboarding and directing a group of Testers, UI/UX Developers, and Back-end Developers for day-to-day activities and providing guidance on project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables at the global level

• Establishing clear goals, productivity and quality objectives, and milestones, tracking progress, and enforcing policies for their benefit • Supporting data-driven insights, risk assessment tools, and educational content to patients, providers, payers, and other stakeholders adhering to compliance standards • Driving strategic partnerships and promoting health equity to deliver Precision Medicine and Healthcare to patients globally; leading Data transfer technology activities from different sources of providers and vendors • Working on internal CPML Accuitive application for doctors across all hospital's databases and providing services on Precision medicine data • Enriching database that has transactional patient data from EMR/EHR and other non-transactional data from various ontologies and databases Principal Business Application Project Manager | Bayer Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd, India Oct 2018 - Oct 2021 Responsibilities: • Supported the Process Owner Representative/Process Manager role with DS&A Application Life Cycle Management for all User Access Management Systems • Supervised and completed proper compliance management comprising all testing and validation activities as per Bayer SOPs and ran UAT as needed • Authored application lifecycle management documentation, including user requirement specifications, process flows, requirement trace matrix, test cases, test scenarios, etc. • Developed the expertise in business processes and reviewed user requirements and user-centric interfaces for change requests • Analysed the impact of new system releases provided by software vendors and specified configuration & integration adjustment needs • Directed a group of Business Application Project Managers on day-to-day activities and delivered directions on their deliverables at a global level; led projects for DS&A functions; interacted with software vendors, business application leads, and R&D IT within projects Manager, Technical Delivery | Bracket Global Technology Pvt Ltd, India Sep 2017 - Oct 2018 Responsibilities: • Employed, guided, and trained a large team of Testing Analysts and other assigned staff to ensure the timely study deliverables and release of business applications • Designed SOPs or work instructions for the process; led projects and implemented Scrum and Agile QA process for all respective Clinical studies by coordinating with Developers, BSA's, and PM • Worked closely with Business System Analysts (BSA) to gain an understanding of business requirements for assigned tasks • Participated in all Scrum meetings with Development & Testing Teams to implement business applications • Ensured all technical documentation is reviewed & approved for projects, and change control documentation is included, including updates to requirements, design, and other technical documents • Adhered to Good Clinical Practices (GCP), 21 CFR Part 11, and other regulatory requirements RTSM - Validation Lead | Bioclinica India Pvt Ltd, Mysore, India May 2016 - Sep 2017 Responsibilities: • Supervised a large team of testing members and other staff to ensure timely study deliverables and release of business applications • Represented the IRT Study QC (Validation) team at customer audits • Trained the IRT Study QC Team on core product enhancements and new functionality • Liaised with Director, study QC to ensure QC processes and procedures meet internal and regulatory requirements • Worked with the Study QC Team to ensure that SOPs and WIs are followed and updated to reflect process changes and improvements, as well as SOP and WI author and reviewer • Streamlined weekly meetings with the team and various departments to discuss and train on clinical applications, QC processes, and documentation • Achieved analysis of project documents from a testing perspective and verified accuracy & completeness

Lead Master Site Manager | Novartis Healthcare Pvt Ltd, India June 2015 - May 2016 Responsibilities: • Headed all technical and operational aspects of the Novartis Interactive Response Technology (NIRT) system, an in-house IRT system, a newly developing system • Secured optimal utilisation and timely delivery of the high-quality NIRT system following protocol requirements and consultation with the Study Demand Planner, Site Demand Planner, and Clinical Trial Team (CTT) Senior Trial Account Manager, IRT Solutions | Novartis Healthcare Pvt Ltd, India April 2015 - June 2015 Responsibilities: • Addressed all technical and operational aspects of the Novartis studies from Start-up to Go-live of IRT system from vendors like Cenduit, Oracle, and Perceptive systems Trial Account Manager, IRT Solutions | Novartis Healthcare Pvt Ltd, India July 2011 - March 2015 Responsibilities: • Scrutinised all operational aspects of the Novartis studies from the go-live stage to throughout maintenance till close-out of the IRT system from vendors like Cenduit, Oracle, and Perceptive systems • Worked with a primary Global Account Manager to evaluate planned trials as potential candidates for Interactive Response Technology (IRT) and assess risks, costs, and benefits of utilising IRT by following all required SOPs and business guidance; concluded RFPs from vendors and successfully awarded studies • Validated IRT vendor setup systems for all studies by performing UATs and implementing go-live within timelines • Drove all SIRT validation activities for vendors - Cenduit and Perceptive and received appreciation from global teams for all releases • Worked on Clinadmin, Credi, NCT Portal, and CTP Portals across global teams; reinforced CTT/DSM in selection of the preferred provider, user requirement specifications (URS), and relevant activities for IRT initiation • Participated mainly with the Clinical Teams involved in the review and validation of the UAT testing • Administered the development, training, maintenance, and close-out of a clinical trial portal as directed PRECEDING ASSIGNMENTS Software Validation Engineer | PAREXEL International Pvt Ltd, Hyderabad, India, Nov 2009 - June 2011 Testing Engineer | Cognizant Technology Solutions, Hyderabad, India, May 2006 - Nov 2009
EDUCATION • Master of Electronics, Andhra University, India, 2003 - 2005 • Bachelor of Computer Science, Andhra University, India, 2001 – 2003

CERTIFICATIONS • GCP and 21CFR Part 11 Novartis Certified Professional • Certified PMP with Novartis Healthcare Pvt Ltd • External PMI Certificate • HIPAA and GDPR Compliance Certificate • Healthcare Management (AHM 250) Certified Professional • Certified Software Quality Analyst (CSQA) Cognizant Professional • Certified Software Test Engineer (CSTE) Cognizant Professional

KEY AWARDS AND RECOGNITIONS • Appreciation from Bracket, Global Director for J&J studies account deliverables • Appreciation from Bioclinica RTSM Global Director for efficient work on validation efforts of Study Report tasks • Above and Beyond award in Novartis by Global Head for efficient work on SIRT project management activities • AOM in the healthcare town hall - Cognizant

data.summary: • Accomplished and scientific-minded professional having 16+ years of experience in clinical IRT operations, people management, R&D clinical software testing services, technical delivery, project management, and compliance • Demonstrable experience in providing clinical operations expertise into the project (e.g., country selection, feasibility, operational input into the design, risks, and external partner management) using new innovative design and delivery models to support governance interactions and project start-up • Extensive experience in directing a testing team of IVRS/IWRS clinical product applications across multiple vendors and leading standard IRT modules for reputed CRO IRT applications • Conversant in collaborating with Clinical Operations, Global Project Management, Quality Assurance and IT, as well as other cross-functional teams to provide management support and guidance regarding the identification, selection, and management of potential new business processes and systems (e.g., CTMS, TMF, Grant Management) in Clinical Operations and Clinical Development • Hands-on experience in maintaining a working knowledge of and assuring compliance with applicable ICH Guidelines, Good Clinical Practices, Regulatory Agency requirements, and Parexel SOPs • In-depth experience in maintaining optimal department processes through continual review and update of standard operating procedures, evaluation of supporting clinical software (e.g., EDC systems, external coding tools, etc.), and development of personnel within the department • Proven experience in managing end to end the User Acceptance Testing for enhancements to Clinical Systems, including identification, planning, sandbox testing, and running UAT • Successfully building strategic relationships with global teams (USA/UK/Basel/Japan/China); deft at working with global functional leaders and external partnerships to support and drive project/programme strategy GLOBAL EXPOSURE • Comprehensive experience in operating in a globally diverse environment and travelled to US (New Jersey) and Basel (Swiss) to provide support on new in-house IRT project activities and implemented in the company Novartis

workExperience.jobDescription:
Responsibilities: 
•Onboarding and directing a group of Testers, UI/UX Developers, and Back-end Developers for day-to-day activities and providing guidance on project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables at the global level 
•Establishing clear goals, productivity and quality objectives, and milestones, tracking progress, and enforcing policies for their benefit 
•Supporting data-driven insights, risk assessment tools, and educational content to patients, providers, payers, and other stakeholders adhering to compliance standards 
•Driving strategic partnerships and promoting health equity to deliver Precision Medicine and Healthcare to patients globally; leading Data transfer technology activities from different sources of providers and vendors 
•Working on internal CPML Accuitive application for doctors across all hospital's databases and providing services on Precision medicine data 
•Enriching database that has transactional patient data from EMR/EHR and other non-transactional data from various ontologies and databases

classification.title: IT business analysts, architects and systems designers
classification.subMajorGroup: SCIENCE, RESEARCH, ENGINEERING AND TECHNOLOGY PROFESSIONALS

workExperience.jobDescription:
Responsibilities: 
•Supported the Process Owner Representative/Process Manager role with DS&A Application Life Cycle Management for all User Access Management Systems 
•Supervised and completed proper compliance management comprising all testing and validation activities as per Bayer SOPs and ran UAT as needed 
•Authored application lifecycle management documentation, including user requirement specifications, process flows, requirement trace matrix, test cases, test scenarios, etc. 
•Developed the expertise in business processes and reviewed user requirements and user-centric interfaces for change requests 
•Analysed the impact of new system releases provided by software vendors and specified configuration & integration adjustment needs 
•Directed a group of Business Application Project Managers on day-to-day activities and delivered directions on their deliverables at a global level; led projects for DS&A functions; interacted with software vendors, business application leads, and R&D IT within projects

Responsibilities: 
•Employed, guided, and trained a large team of Testing Analysts and other assigned staff to ensure the timely study deliverables and release of business applications 
•Designed SOPs or work instructions for the process; led projects and implemented Scrum and Agile QA process for all respective Clinical studies by coordinating with Developers, BSA's, and PM 
•Worked closely with Business System Analysts (BSA) to gain an understanding of business requirements for assigned tasks 
•Participated in all Scrum meetings with Development & Testing Teams to implement business applications 
•Ensured all technical documentation is reviewed & approved for projects, and change control documentation is included, including updates to requirements, design, and other technical documents 
•Adhered to Good Clinical Practices (GCP), 21 CFR Part 11, and other regulatory requirements

Responsibilities: 
•Supervised a large team of testing members and other staff to ensure timely study deliverables and release of business applications 
•Represented the IRT Study QC (Validation) team at customer audits 
•Trained the IRT Study QC Team on core product enhancements and new functionality 
•Liaised with Director, study QC to ensure QC processes and procedures meet internal and regulatory requirements 
•Worked with the Study QC Team to ensure that SOPs and WIs are followed and updated to reflect process changes and improvements, as well as SOP and WI author and reviewer 
•Streamlined weekly meetings with the team and various departments to discuss and train on clinical applications, QC processes, and documentation 
•Achieved analysis of project documents from a testing perspective and verified accuracy & completeness

Responsibilities: 
•Headed all technical and operational aspects of the Novartis Interactive Response Technology (NIRT) system, an in-house IRT system, a newly developing system 
•Secured optimal utilisation and timely delivery of the high-quality NIRT system following protocol requirements and consultation with the Study Demand Planner, Site Demand Planner, and Clinical Trial Team (CTT)

workExperience.jobTitle: Senior Trial Account Manager, IRT Solutions
workExperience.jobDescription:
Responsibilities: 
•Addressed all technical and operational aspects of the Novartis studies from Start-up to Go-live of IRT system from vendors like Cenduit, Oracle, and Perceptive systems

occupation.jobTitle: Senior Trial Account Manager, IRT Solutions

classification.title: Research and development (R&D) managers
classification.minorGroup: Research and Development (R&D) and Other Research Professionals
classification.subMajorGroup: SCIENCE, RESEARCH, ENGINEERING AND TECHNOLOGY PROFESSIONALS

workExperience.jobDescription:
Responsibilities: 
•Scrutinised all operational aspects of the Novartis studies from the go-live stage to throughout maintenance till close-out of the IRT system from vendors like Cenduit, Oracle, and Perceptive systems 
•Worked with a primary Global Account Manager to evaluate planned trials as potential candidates for Interactive Response Technology (IRT) and assess risks, costs, and benefits of utilising IRT by following all required SOPs and business guidance; concluded RFPs from vendors and successfully awarded studies 
•Validated IRT vendor setup systems for all studies by performing UATs and implementing go-live within timelines 
•Drove all SIRT validation activities for vendors - Cenduit and Perceptive and received appreciation from global teams for all releases 
•Worked on Clinadmin, Credi, NCT Portal, and CTP Portals across global teams; reinforced CTT/DSM in selection of the preferred provider, user requirement specifications (URS), and relevant activities for IRT initiation 
•Participated mainly with the Clinical Teams involved in the review and validation of the UAT testing 
•Administered the development, training, maintenance, and close-out of a clinical trial portal as directed PRECEDING ASSIGNMENTS

classification.minorGroup: Research and Development (R&D) and Other Research Professionals
